isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - CAB: 5000, 9100, 9200, 9300, 9400 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - AIR WIPER CONTROL VALVES (HEADER MOUNTED)

step1.para: Remove the 6 mounting screws ( Item 4, Figure 91) from the cab header and lower the windshield wiper/washer control panel ( Item 7, Figure 91).

Pull the wiper/washer control panel ( Item 7, Figure 91) down to gain access to the back of the control panel. Disconnect the air lines ( Item 2, Figure 92) to the wiper control valves ( Items 3 and 8, Figure 92), then disconnect electrical connections ( Item 6, Figure 92) to the washer control switch ( Item 4, Figure 92) and indicator lights ( Item 2, Figure 91).

With the wiper/washer control panel ( Item 7, Figure 91) removed from the header, use a small hex key wrench to loosen the control knob set screw. Pull the control knob ( Item 5, Figure 92) from the valve knob shaft ( Item 4, Figure 95) of the wiper control valve ( Items 3 and 8, Figure 92).

Mark the position of the wiper control valves ( Items 3 and 8, Figure 92) on the wiper/washer control panel ( Item 7, Figure 92) so the position of the air line ports will be positioned properly at installation. Remove the hex nut and lockwasher ( Items 2 and 3, Figure 95) from the wiper control valves and remove the wiper control valves from the wiper/washer control panel.

calloutgroup.callout1: 3. HEX NUT 40 TO 50 IN-LBS. (4.5 TO 5.6 NM)

step1.para: Position both wiper control valves in the wiper/washer control panel. Use the marks made during removal to align the wiper control valves on the wiper/washer control panel so that the air line ports will line up with the air line fittings during installation.
Install the lockwasher and hex nut securing the wiper control valves on the wiper/washer control panel. Tighten to 40 to 50 in-lbs. (4.5 to 5.6 Nm).
Place the control knob onto the wiper control valve knob shaft of the wiper control valves. Use a small hex key wrench to tighten the set screw securing the control knob.

Position the wiper/washer control panel at the driver side header panel opening. Reconnect the air lines to the wiper control valves, then reconnect electrical connections to the washer control switch and indicator lights.

note.para: Air line with white tape goes on fitting nearest control panel ( Item 7, Figure 92).

step1.para: Position the wiper/washer control panel on the header panel, being sure the air lines do not kink and that the washer control switch and indicator light connecting wires are not pinched. Install the 6 mounting screws securing the control panel to the header. Tighten to 10 in-lbs. (1.2 Nm).
